review_title: Always busy and I love it!
pros:
Flexible Schedule
Family Environment
Responsive
cons: Clients with challenging MH issues

pros: You can make a difference. Work with some caring and knowledgable people.
cons: Pay isn't great and administration out of touch

job_title: Director of Development in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Great work! Really essential to the community. The staff and directors are really incredible.
cons: The CEO is the main issue with this agency. How he wants work to be completed changes, making it very hard to complete a task to his standards. Everyone is incredibly stressed and often place blame on other departments when the CEO is unhappy with their work and often the issues he has feel baseless and trivial. Hope they can figure out the culture a bit more. Claim to be trauma informed but I don't see that philosophy being extended to staff due to leadership.

pros: Mostly good coworkers; useful training opportunities
cons: Ridiculous workload expectations; really low pay

pros: You get reimbursed .54 cents a mile.
cons: They promise you flexibility, but really there is zero. The job description does not match the realities of the job. As a case manager you spend your works days driving kids around and moonlighting as basically their parent. You get ridiculously far behind on paperwork due to spending the day traveling. You're expected to do a lot of work in 40 hours. You will work more than 40, but they want you to no clock it in. You also are not legally protected when conducting your job.  You will be expected to work around 10-12 hours a day, 5 days a week. You will get very minimal support from your supervisors. Those above supervisors seem to not care at all about front line staff.  Auberle goes through a repetitve staffing crisis, that case managers bear the burdens of.

pros: You can pretty much make your schedule and can work from home if you do not have any visits or court hearings.
cons: No work-personal life boundaries. There's no over time even if you're on-call (which is mandatory) even on-call you have to flex you time during another part of the week so you do not go over 40 hours. You are expected to respond to emails and answer your phone even on your day off. The works load and the pay wage don't match at all. There's no accountability. You can do your job perfectly and  someone else can not do their job at all and reap the same benefits and bonuses.

review_title: Great entry into social work, but management needs a lot of work
pros:
- Excellent coworkers, most if not all are passionate 
- Great with with trainings and keeping up with industry standards
cons:
- Management will not hide things from you, but also won't tell you about things that impact your position until it's too late
- Wording in the employee handbook (especially in regards to raises and disciplinary actions) is just vague enough to apply to everything and nothing at the same time

pros: Great experience to work here to really decide if working in social services is the right career path for you. You will either love it or hate it, no in-betweens!!
cons: Clients are social welfare suckers who will use everything and everyone to continue to live off government assistance. You cannot balance work and life here because the hours are so strenuous. The compensation is minimal for the work, which is really sad. Jobs like these can never compensate enough for the drainage they cause in your life and motivation.

pros: Auberle received the National Agency of the Year awad by the Alliance for Children and Families. This is one of the most prestigious social service awardsin the country. Senior managment is committed to providing an excellent work environment for their employees. Working with at-risk children and their families is not easy, but they do their best to provide staff with the training and tools necessary to be successful.
cons: As with most nonprofits, the salaries are on the low end compared to the for profit world.

pros: They will hire pretty much anyone that can pass a background check.
cons: They simply do not care about their employees. They will throw you under the bus the first chance they get without thinking about it no matter how long you have been with the company. It is required to have three people to do functions of the job, such as a physical restraint of a client,  but they will only schedule two people. The mission of the company is noble the execution is very poor.

review_title: A lost ship on the sea with no wind
pros: Helping kids and good scheduling. Saw young lives changed.
cons: Management is the worst ever!! Crumbled everything. Lies, finesse, etc

pros: Great working environment. Very supportive leadership staff. Doing great work for children.
cons: Sometimes things got a little hectic, and could have used more staff.

pros: Lot of room to do what you need to do
cons: Poor pay and benefits are unstable
